intro: Rogiera elegantissima, commonly known as the elegant rogeria, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
